The Democratic candidates are most a bunch of XXXXXX.
 From Al Sharpton - No political history, dropped out of college
 To Kucinich - Was against removing Taliban and says he would pull troops our of Iraq immediatley
 
 Wesley Clark has no real political experince. Being a good leader does not make you a good president. Just last April he was praising the Bush Administration.
 
 Deans anti war position as well as his comments about the Confederate flag and that Hammas were soldiers that were fighting in a war, he established himself as someone I would not vote for.
 
 Enough slamming the Democrats:
 Onto the good ones
 
 Gephardt - I have no problems with him. He actaully has political expereince.
 
 Lieberman - I support Lieberman above all. I agree with the majority of his policies from what I have seen. In interviews I have seen he is more straight forward than most politicans and I think he stands behind his policies not for political reasons but rather becuase he beleives in them. 
 
 
 What are your thoughts? Who is best fit to become the next president of the United States? Who has the best bet at beating Bush?
 
 (By the way, I would vote for Bush probably over every candidate except Gephardt and Lieberman)

I agree with you completly, I think most of the democratic candidates are unexperienced or left-wing extremists who don't deserve a position in the white house. I tend to like Lieberman and Edwards and I definetly think they have the best chance against Bush. Lieberman is a moderate and he believes in a strong defense which really resonates with the south, and John Edwards is southern. The last non-southern president was JFK, and that was a pretty long time ago if I remember correctly.

It does seem important, though, not to forget that the Republicans will very likely try to run mostly on national defense. Since Democrats are generally considered weak in this regard, perhaps an impressive military background should be considered vital. (Kerry or Clark)

i cant believe that Dean was once thought to be the ideal candidate, im not american, but even i could see that he does not has enough awareness of the country to lead it. itseems to me that the citizens want a person who is willing to lead, and not contnue an ongoing arguement, such as th war, when there are more important issues to focus, like the economy.

Electibility -
 
 On the exit polls there is one vital quality, that to voters, Kerry seems to posses. They think he is electible.
 Why?
 
 ..........
 
 
 Surely the American people aren't silly enough to beleive that the newsweek polls that show Kerry ahead of Bush mean something. They don't. We still have a solid five months of debates, campaigning, and fundrasing. This gives plenty of time for major events and slip-ups.
 
 When you vote for someone in a primary, electibility is kind of a silly quality to vote on.
 
 Because its what will make them electible that counts and that you should vote for:
 
 Background
 Personality
 Views
 Intelligence
 Voting Record
 Message
 Etc...
 
 When the voters come to the general election are they going to look at the two candidates and say: "Hmmm... he looks electible"
 
 Of course not. They are going to vote on the things mentioned above.
 
 Any comments?
 
 No they are going to vote on

At this point I don't think anyone other than Kerry could be Bush simply because everyone sees him as the democratic front runner. Put a Dean up against Bush and you get a slaugther. Same goes for a Liberman who isn't even posing a challenge for the democrats. Kerry with a strong VP is going to have the best chance at this point.
Woops. I put my previous post on the wrong thread.

I think dean would have had the best chace of beating Bush. Dean was conservative enough that he could have won some of the republican vote (I would have voted for him).
 
 Instead, the democrats have stuck themselves with kerry. Maybe he can win, maybe not. He is certainly not going to be winning any republican votes away from the president.

I think dean would have had the best chace of beating Bush. Dean was conservative enough that he could have won some of the republican vote (I would have voted for him).
 
 
 
 Bush would have slaughtered Dean.
 
 Why would Republicans vote for him?
 He's pro abortion
 Anti Iraq War
 Pro Affirmative Action
 
 I consider myself to be independent and just being against the war in Iraq made me not like him.
 
 Not to mention
 His ridiculous comments
 His suspected temper

As the mess in Iraq and the "intelligence" (or lack thereof) questions are answered, you are going to see more Americans, even republicans, starting to question the president. 
 
 Howard dean was pretty consistent on the anti-war issue. Right from the start he called it a bad idea. Dean is also light on gun control (Look at Vermonts gun laws).
 
 I would have voted for Dean. Now my vote would have to swing back to Bush. Kerry is too "progressive", and he seems to have the same type of selective memory that Clinton had. 
 
 I know that the media was pretty tough on dean over his excited speach after the primary. I know that particular speach scored him a lot of points with some folks. Maybe it is time to have a president with some personality who is willing (and actually able) to get excited.
 
 Abortion and affirmative action have kind of lost their wind. We (conservatives) lost. There are going to be bigger issues in the upcoming election. Right now, Kerry sems to be running a pretty good campaign ( based ont he poll numbers I just heard on MSNBC) based on his war record and by questioning bush's national gaurd service. Give it some time. Once bush actually goes on the offensive, there are too many chinks in kerrys armor for him to win.

The Democrats are trying to say "Oh, the president lied to me!"
 
 But that just doesn't work when you're seeing the same stuff the president is seeing and voting for action. :-\ They're going to be called on that hypcrisy, but they are still going to use it, and I think it will only hurt them.

Well, with most of the candidates gone, we're down to:
 
 1) Kerry
 2) Dean
 3) Edwards
 4) Sharpton
 5) Kucinich
 
 Dean will probably drop out after the next primary if he doesn't do good [it's Michigan, right?], Sharpton and Kucinich should've dropped a long time ago [although I've heard that Kucinich is gonna stay in the whole way], and Edwards is trailing far behind in the polls/primaries/caucases. So we all know that Kerry is most likely going to be the Democratic candidate.
 
 But can he beat Bush? I don't really know yet. Like SilentPoet said, there's still a long time for debates and other things, and many people won't make up their mind until the end.
 
 Who do I support? Nixon/Agnew in '04! emoticon_xgood
I think Kerry has the best chance, but I like Dean and Kucinich better.

I think Kerry has the best chance, but I like Dean and Kucinich better.

 
 "Kucinich" is the king of XXXXXX. 
 
 The UN in and the US out?
 The UN ran away after their first bombing. How could they possibly be expected to control security over the country. Saddam loyalists would control the country within weeks.
